title: Directed Honors Thesis in Classical Studies
discription: BA honors thesis research under the direction of a member of a classical studies program faculty.
prerequsite: acceptance into the classical studies honors program and consent of instructor.

title: Contemporary Literary Theory and the Classics
discription: An introduction to contemporary literary theory, focusing on important critical approaches to the literary texts. May be repeated for credit as topics vary.

title: Diachronic Perspectives on Classical Antiquity
discription: Examines ways in which classical texts and ideas have been received and appropriated for the diverse purposes of ancient and subsequent cultures. May be repeated for credit as topics vary.

title: Greece and Rome in Their Contemporary Cultural Contexts
discription: An introduction to the methods and perspectives of social scientific theory that can be used to study the material and social dimensions of the cultures of ancient Greece and Rome. May be repeated for credit as topics vary.

title: Concurrent Readings
discription: May be repeated for credit as topics vary.

title: Classics Graduate Seminar
discription: Subject matter variable; mainly but not exclusively major literary topics. May be repeated for credit as topics vary.

title: Independent Study
discription: Supervised independent research. Subject varies. May be repeated for credit.

title: Research in Classics
discription: Research under Classics faculty. May be repeated for credit.

title: Dissertation Research
discription: Dissertation research with Classics faculty. May be repeated for credit.

title: University Teaching
discription: Required of and limited to teaching assistants. Satisfactory/unsatisfactory grade only. May be repeated for credit.
